alert.note: Alert for Camden; Gloucester (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 4:11PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Camden, northwestern Gloucester, southwestern Philadelphia and southeastern Delaware Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 411 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Paulsboro, or 8 miles southwest of Gloucester City. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Philadelphia, Gloucester City, Deptford, West Deptford, Bellmawr, Yeadon, Woodbury, Folcroft, Paulsboro, Magnolia, Westville, Woodbury Heights, National Park, Brooklawn, Darby Township, South Philadelphia, Philadelphia International Arpt, Philadelphia International Airport, Gibbstown and Tinicum Township. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike near exit 3. Interstate 95 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 9 and 19. Interstate 76 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 346 and 351. Interstate 76 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 1, and near mile marker 3. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 14 and 28. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
